column1: original
1: academy (?k?d?mi) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. BNC1: It should also be noted that many of these issues have not greatly exercised the academic community in this country.
2. BNC2: Many academics, being civil servants, have secure jobs guaranteed for life.
3. Other: The college offers both academic and professional qualifications.
4. Other: Although this child is bright, he is not academically inclined.
2: adjust (????st) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. Other: It took a few seconds for her eyes to adjust to the darkness.
2. Other: When economic circumstances change, businesses need time to adjust.
3. Other: We'll see how this schedule works; then we'll make adjustments as necessary.
4. Other: Former soldiers often struggle to readjust to life outside the army.
3: alter (??lt?) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. Other: The city center has altered beyond recognition.
2. Other: Nothing can alter the fact that the refugees are our responsibility.
3. Other: Much of the original building has survived unaltered.
4. Other: The editor made a few minor alterations to the text.
4: amend (?m?nd) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. BNC1: One of the claimed advantages of expert systems are that their knowledge basis can be amended quickly and easily.
2. BNC2: Lists of amendments or new editions are possible mechanisms for announcing changes.
3. Other: I have made several amendments to the script.
4. Other: Until the constitution is amended, the power to appoint ministers will remain with the president.
5: aware (?w??) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. BNC1: We are not always aware of how we affect others or how they experience our actions.
2. Other: Increased environmental awareness has led to a greater demand for recycled paper.
3. Other: The campaign aims to raise awareness of the dangers of passive smoking.
4. Other: She was totally unaware that she was being watched.
6: capacity (k?p?s?ti) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. Other: The fuel tank has a capacity of 200 liters.
2. Other: The factory is now operating at full capacity.
3. Other: Her poor health limits her earning capacity.
4. Other: Using powerful lasers, the device can incapacitate enemy radar systems.
7: challenge (??l?n?) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. I was bored with my job and felt I needed a new challenge.
2. The government faces a daunting challenge of completing the building on time.
3. Recent discoveries pose a serious challenge to accepted views on the age of the universe.
4. Teaching young children is a challenging and rewarding job.

8: clause (kl??z) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. Other: There is a clause in the contrast requiring a fee to be paid if the holiday is canceled.

implemented.
9: compound (k??mpa?nd) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. BNC1: A reduction in Scotch production would seriously compound these difficulties.

3. Other: Water is a compound of hydrogen and oxygen.
4. Other: Teaching is a compound of several different skills.
10: conflict (k??nfl?kt) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL

3. Other: There is a growing conflict of interest between her position as a politician and her business activities.
4. Other: UN troops intervened to avert a threat of violent conflict.
11: consult (k?ns??lt) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL

2. Other: If symptoms persist, consult a doctor without delay.

4. Other: A team of management consultants were sent in to reorganize the department.
12: contact (k??nt??kt) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. Other: The town is cut off from contact with the outside world.
2. Other: When water comes into contact with air, carbon dioxide is released.

4. Other: A mobile phone makes you contactable wherever you are.

Level: AWL
1. BNC1: With the decline of these markets, the company has been forced to look elsewhere or face the same fate as IBM.

Level: AWL

16: enable (en??b?l) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. BNC1: Similarly, disabled persons needed to be enabled by appropriate technology.

17: energy (?n??i) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. BNC1: Take the Sun, the star from which we ultimately derive nearly all our energy.
2. BNC2: Thus short-wave radiation, which has more energy, is likely to be more dangerous than long wave.
3. Other: We need to be more energetic in promoting ourselves abroad.
4. Other: Nelson Mandela fought energetically against apartheid.
18: enforce (enf???s) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. BNC1: A legal ban on the hunting of wildlife is not strictly enforced.
2. BNC2: This should help ensure that any recommendations made are both practical and enforceable.
3. Other: It is not always easy for the police to enforce speed limits.
4. Other: The doctors want stricter enforcement of existing laws, such as those banning sales of cigarettes to children.
19: entity (?nt?ti) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. Other: The universities often work closely together, but they are separate legal entities.
2. Other: The mind exists as a separate entity from the body.
3. Other: Good design brings a house and garden as a single entity.
4. Other: These countries can no longer be viewed as a single entity.

1. BNC1: Mathematicians among you will notice that these are, in fact, not exact equivalents.
2. Other: This word has no equivalent in Japanese.

4. Other: This amount of exercise is equivalent to walking about three miles.
21: evolve (?v??lv) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL

22: expand (?ksp?nd) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. BNC1: In 1992 we continued to expand our coal production, and mined 1.7 million tonnes by the year end.

3. Other: The rapid expansion of third-world cities can cause social and economic problems.

23: expose (?ksp??z) Appears in List(s): 5a

4. Other: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin cancer.
24: external (?kst??n?l) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. BNC1: The effect, however, is the same, whether it originates from an external source or from an internal one.

interfaces.
3. Other: The job should be advertised internally and externally.

25: facilitate (f?s??l?t??t) Appears in List(s): 5a
Level: AWL
1. BNC1: A journal such as this which seeks to facilitate the spread of technology is therefore very much to be welcomed.
2. Other: Computers can be used to facilitate foreign language learning.
3. Other: The hotel has excellent leisure facilities.
4. Other: I see my role as that of a facilitator, enabling other people to work in the way that suits them best.

4. Other: The Internet has fundamentally changed the way people communicate with one another.
